## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've heard about the Verus DeFi Testnet, but I'm not really sure what it is or what it's for. Can you explain?

**AI Assistant:**
The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that allows testing and hardening of new Verus protocols before they are released on the mainnet. It is a platform for developers and users to try out new capabilities and features in a live environment, with no real value attached to the currencies and assets on the testnet. This allows for experimentation and testing without any real-world consequences.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. What are some of the key features of the Verus DeFi Testnet?

**AI Assistant:**
Some of the key features of the Verus DeFi Testnet include a 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake consensus algorithm, worldwide availability, integration of DeFi and cross-currency liquidity with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, and a 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm. These features make the testnet a great place to try out new ideas and see how they work in a real-world environment.

**User:**
I'd like to try out the Verus DeFi Testnet and see what it's all about. How can I get started?

**AI Assistant:**
To get started with the Verus DeFi Testnet, you can visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel for a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf. Once you have the testnet currencies, you can start exploring the testnet and trying out its new features. If you have any questions or need help, feel free to ask in the Discord channel and someone will be happy to assist you.
What is the Verus DeFi Testnet, and what is its purpose?

The Verus DeFi Testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network that allows testing and hardening of new Verus protocols before they are released on the mainnet. It is a platform for developers and users to try out new capabilities and features in a live environment, with no real value attached to the currencies and assets on the testnet.

## The New Verus DeFi Testnet
This is the most groundbreaking testnet the Verus project has ever announced, and we believe it holds the potential to improve and reshape the DeFi industry. There are truly so many new capabilities and blockchain firsts working now on testnet that it’s hard to adequately cover them all. Below is a list of new capabilities active on the v0.7.2 testnet that will be on mainnet in the near future when considered fully hardened, tested, and ready for worldwide, public scale. Until then, Verus testnet is a fully decentralized blockchain network with 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake, worldwide availability, and is running all of the new Verus protocols that are being tested and hardened for mainnet. All currencies and assets on the Verus testnet have absolutely no value and may be reset at any time in the interest of testing for mainnet. If you would like a representative basket of Verus testnet currencies that you can use to try out all of the new protocols from anywhere in the world, simply visit the Verus Discord and ask in the #pbaas-development channel. You can use this link as an invite to the Verus Discord: https://discord.gg/gecZsCf- **DeFi and cross-currency liquidity integrated with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP, 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm** - This is a massive set of platform capabilities that take DeFi further than any project in crypto today. We will list it here and describe it below. Using it is simple. Understanding the implications of what such a protocol can do when rent free and integrated in a truly decentralized public blockchain is a process of realizations that is likely to be similar to layers of an onion. We will do our best to explain below.
What are some of the key features of the Verus DeFi Testnet?

Some of the key features of the Verus DeFi Testnet include:

* 50% proof of work, 50% proof of stake consensus algorithm
* Worldwide availability
* Integration of DeFi and cross-currency liquidity with blockchain processing, fees, VerusID, and Verus PoP
* 51% hash-attack resistant consensus algorithm
